This was the highlight of the last day in Barcelona after visiting Montjuic castle earlier in the day.  Thanks to google maps - we made it to this restaurant.What a treat to have the seafood paella.  Perfectly cooked rice with the grains being separate from one another.  Flavorful with the various seafood incorporated incorporated into the dish - mussels, clams, scallops, and prawns to name a few.  Nothing like the mushy globs of rice without definition that I have had at other places.The house wine was great.  Crispy, floral, dry - perfect for the hot weather.The steamed mussels was amazing.  Something so simple done wrong a most places - leaving an overcooked, rubbery, chewy item.  Not here.  Their muscles were tender and juicy.  It was cooked with attention and love.
